utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad! What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: You have 30 seconds to suit up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A game is afoot.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. Let me savor this. I haven’t got the drop on you since you were 10. Oh, this feels like … victory.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, look. I can’t, okay? I have a big decision to make.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, have you at least narrowed it down?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I made a list of all the classes and extra circulars. And the best choices seem to be Oxford and Stanford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Columbia? NYU? Vassar?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re all too close. I’d come home all the time. I want to challenge myself. And I’d get sucked into things like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But then who’s gonna play with me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think it’s time to holster the laser guns and be adults.

utterance.speaker: VEST COMPUTER VOICE
utterance.content: Game over. Please proceed to exit.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, darling. It’s just a game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s not. It’s a time honored family tradition that we’ve been honoring since Alexis could wrap her little finger around a trigger. First one to a thousand points wins. And we were so close. We laser tagged our way through her preteen years and now, suddenly, she’s too old to play.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She’s growing up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well she doesn’t have to. Look at me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! Well it seems like Detective Beckett is available for a playdate.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett and I have not exactly been … hitting it off lately.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh huh. And why do you think that is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. Are you saying that it’s my fault?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Cavorting with some awful gang detective, showing up at a crime scene with a stewardess? If you want to punish Beckett at least let her know why.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not punishing her. I’m – Am I?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, darling. You’re hurt. I understand that. But quite honestly, the two of you cannot go on like this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what, Mother? You’re absolutely right.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To a crime scene. Work my last case with Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Thought you didn’t like coffee?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I like vanilla lattes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks for calling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, our victim is David Locke, 29. He’s a currency trader at a foreign exchange office upstairs. Looks like he was heading into work when it happened. His body was found by his boss at around 7 o’clock this morning.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ah, our intrepid heroes have arrived. And Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Perlmutter. I will treasure these special moments we’ve shared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I take it this is Mr. Locke?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It appears he was set upon by an unknown assailant. Time of death was about 4AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cause of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Well, probably blunt force trauma to the head where it hit the concrete.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wallet and cash?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Still intact, so it definitely wasn’t a mugging.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Savage beating at 4AM, there must be some motive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this a bite mark on his arm?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It’s not just a bite mark. Look at the skin. You see how it’s torn? The killer latched on and shook like a pitbull trying to tear off the flesh –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks. I think we got it. Anything else?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just this. It was, uh, found in out victim’s hand. It was probably torn off the killer’s shirt during the struggle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a lace cuff. Hand stitched, pearl buttons, I’d say this was circa … 1870.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did a lot of research on the era. I was writing a book. A comedy about the Civil War. Turns out, not so funny.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: You don’t say.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who would beat a guy to death wearing a hundred and fifty year old shirt?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, the bigger question is, why was he attacked here where he worked?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Might wanna ask his boss, Mike Matthews.

utterance.speaker: MIKE MATTHEWS
utterance.content: I can’t believe it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We think that David was killed around 4AM. Do you have any idea why he was here so early?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: David handled the Asian markets, so he usually got in by 4. He was a terrific kid. He was hard working, well liked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was that the consensus?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean did he have any conflicts with anyone at work?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Actually, yeah, there was an incident last week. Someone keyed his car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: David thought it was Charlie Coleman, one of my other traders. The two of them were vying for a promotion and I went with David. Charlie didn’t take it too well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time does Charlie usually show up for work?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: 4AM. Same time as David. Look, Charlie’s kind of an oddball, but I – I don’t see him mixed up in this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re gonna need to talk to him anyway.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: That’s strange. His car is right there, next to David’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why is that strange?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Because Charlie never came into the office this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his address?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s a shame. This case had real promise. Savage bite marks, reconstruction era clothing. It’s a mystery here, a whiff of intrigue. Now we’re just slapping cuffs on some disgruntled employee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wanted this one to be special.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m sorry it’s not entertaining enough for you, Castle. Charlie Coleman! NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Stay away! It isn’t safe!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stand back.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: It’s for your own good! Don’t come in!

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You can’t come in here!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s all right, Charlie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlie, are you okay? Anyone here?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: No, no, no. Stay back. Stay away from me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, we just gotta ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You need to leave! You need to leave right now! It’s not safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Relax, Charlie. Relax. We’re cops.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You’re a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Is that your gun?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You need to shoot me. Do it now! Do it! Do it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charlie, you feeling better?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just gotta ask you a few questions about what happened this morning with you and David. Did you see him in the parking structure?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yeah, he had just pulled in. I said hello, he said hello. The two of us aren’t real friendly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’ve heard. What happened next?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: And then he stopped. And he stared right past me with this weird look on his face and he the said ‘what the hell is that?’.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the hell was it?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I couldn’t tell at first because that thing was all over us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, you were attacked too?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it was mostly after David. I mean, it was just wailing on him. I elbowed it in the head, but it didn’t even slow down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, what do you mean by it?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I called 911, they didn’t believe me. No one believes me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just tell us what you saw.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: As long as you promise you’ll believe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, fine. I promise.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Promise that you will use your gun on me when I start to turn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean, turn?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: The thing that bit me? That killed David? It was a zombie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A … zombie?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: It was a zombie! I freaking zombie!

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: A zombie! The undead! Oh man. With those dead eyes and flaps of rotting skin coming off its face.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yes! I’m having a major emergency here! Don’t you get it? This thing just killed someone and it bit me. I’m gonna turn! I’m next!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now Charlie made this 911 call moments after the attack. Does it sound like he’s faking to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It sounds like Charlie’s having an psychotic break. What if his guilt made him snap and he created a fantasy in which zombies killed David and not him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not so sure. I mean, his voice does have that authentic ring of pants-wetting terror.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You do not believe in Charlie’s story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I believe that he believes it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well whatever you believe, all the evidence points to the fact that Charlie Coleman is our killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe not all the evidence. CSU analyzed that bite mark on Charlie’s arm. It turns out it matches the bite mark on our victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Charlie bit David and then he bit himself?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was thinking the same thing, but CSU also says that the bite marks weren’t made by Charlie’s teeth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, wait … um… sorry. Let me make sure I understand, so I might properly relish this moment. You’re saying the evidence shows that Charlie and the victim both were bitten by an as yet unknown third party.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s what I just said –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps even a mindless, shuffling, undead third party?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, just stop. There’s no such thing as a zombie.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Guys – You gotta see this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So I was combing through security cam footage near the parking garage and I found this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Time stamp’s 4:06AM, which fits time of death. That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s not Charlie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what is he wearing? That looks like an old fashioned suit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Circa 1870. And his shirt’s missing a cuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa. He almost got his by that taxi, didn’t even flinch.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well maybe this is why. Look what we get from the other angle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My friends. That is a zombie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our killer’s a zombie.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well you’re rather upbeat considering you said this was your last case with Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s because I am going out with a bang. I have one word for you, Mother. Zombie.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Too much makeup?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look lovely. I’m referring to our victim being killed by one of the walking undead. And I mean that literally. A zombie. A security camera caught him in all his putrefying glory.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Whoo. I don’t suppose you downloaded this video by chance?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely not. That video is police property. It would be very, very wrong of me to … get a screen grab of it and email it to myself.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oooh… it’ll be our little secret, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m actually surprised that you’re interested in this case, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I really do know the difference between a first rate makeup job and actual decay. You want to see some real zombies check out the red carpet at the Tony awards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. I thought I – I thought I put this away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is she? Where –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You were fooled by my act yesterday and now you’ve fallen right into my trap.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You will pay dearly for your treachery. E tu, Mother? For luring me here?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Why, whatever do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. That’s my girl.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So what’s this about a zombie?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Oh. My God. I told you people. That’s him. Oh, so vile and disgusting. That’s the zombie that I saw.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well we’re not exactly sure that he’s –

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: What do you mean you’re not sure? What else could he be?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Point is, this puts you in the clear. We’re releasing you.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I’m not sure that’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Charlie, if you were going to turn you’d have done it by now.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: This thing, have you caught it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. Rest assured, we will.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I’ll just stay here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won’t leave?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Charlie’s pretty convinced about this whole zombie thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s just – that’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or is it? Charlie has not been wrong yet. Maybe our killer is patient zero, other there right now on the streets of New York building an army of the undead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what we are looking for is not a zombie but a very smart criminal who murdered David Locke and is now making our only witness look crazy. And he also dressed up in makeup and a costume to hide his identity.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless that’s not costume or makeup.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I mean, he does look like a real zombie.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A real zombie? I’m embarrassed for you, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then explain this. Why would a zombie go after a currency trader, at 4AM, in a garage?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This one’s easy. The more intelligent the victim, the more delicious the brains.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, returning to the land of facts, what did you find at the crime scene canvass?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nada. Only in New York could some guy dress like a friggin’ zombie and walk down the street unnoticed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did find a gap in our timeline before the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to the doorman, the victim left his apartment at 2AM and he never came back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was killed at 4AM. What was he doing for 2 hours?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he drove there. His credit card showed that he gased up on Houston at 2:44AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s figure out where he went. Trouble might have followed him to the garage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or a zombie did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll tell you where he went. Booty call. Tech guys pulled a text message off David’s phone. He sent it to a chica the night he died, wanting to hook up with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does she have a name?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Greta Mastroianni.

utterance.speaker: GRETA MASTROIANNI
utterance.content: I – I don’t understand. Who would do something like this to David?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you see him that night? We know that he texted you wanting to come over.

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: No. I called him and told him not to come over.

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: I split up with David about a week ago. He was still trying to hold on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why’d you two split up?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: I’m engaged. Um… to Tom. Tom Williams. We’ve been together five years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did David figure in?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: I met him when I was 21, visiting a cousin in LA. We had an intense couple of weeks, you know, and three months ago I ran into him at a coffee shop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And did you fiancé know about this affair with David?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: Yeah, he found emails on my computer last week.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And how did he react to that?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: He was hurt. He threatened to leave me and that’s when I realized what I was about to lose, so I broke it off with David and begged Tom to give me another chance. And he did.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So where was Tom that night?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: Home. We went to bed around 11.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And he was there all night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Greta, where was Tom at 4AM?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: Look, I don’t know, okay? I woke up around 2:30 and he wasn’t there. I figured he was watching TV in the living room but when I got up in the morning –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He wasn’t in the apartment, so where was he all night?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: I see what you’re getting at with this, okay? But Tom had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did David email you from his office account?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: Yeah. Why?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because that means that your fiancé knew where David worked.

utterance.speaker: TOM WILLIAMS
utterance.content: Look, I can’t say I feel bad this guy’s dead. But I had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Even though he was trying to snake your fiancée?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: He was out of the picture. Greta made her choice and she picked me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except he wouldn’t take no for an answer. You know, I bet you found out that he was texting her and you decided to make him stop texting her. Permanently.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Well, you’re wrong. I never touched the dude. I never even met him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but it had to have made you angry.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I won’t lie to you. This whole thing had been tough. But Greta and I are building a life together and I think we’re going to come out of it stronger –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tom, how tall are you? About 6 foot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So about the same height as this guy, right?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: What the hell is that? C’mon, that’s not me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When you left the apartment that night, where were you for the next hour and a half? David was missing for the same amount of time, 2:30 to 4AM.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I was a the Hudson Law Library, studying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were at the library at that hour?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: It’s open 24/7 during finals. You can ask the librarian and the 10 other people who were studying there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tom’s alibi checks out. He was at the law library between 3 and 6AM. I really thought he was our man. It’s not like David Locke has any other enemies. I mean, we confirmed that with his friends and coworkers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about recently deceased friends and coworkers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well, whatever or whoever this is, can we at least agree that he looks like a zombie, he dressed like a zombie, and he acts like a zombie?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that helps us how?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re looking at standard motives here. But our killer isn’t driven by revenge, greed, or power. Not if he thinks he’s a zombie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So by that line of thinking, his motive is a primal urge to kill? Regardless of who the victim is, he kills at random.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Precisely.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how do you propose we find a random killer in a city of 8 million people?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe we start with where the victim went during those missing 2 hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do tell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well the lab ID’d a chemical found recently deposited on the bottom of David Locke’s shoes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of chemical?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh… I won’t even begin to try to pronounce it, but it is used in 3 factories in New York and New Jersey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night that David was killed he went to a gas station on Houston. Which one of those factories is closest to Houston?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The one on the lower East Side, but it’s been closed for over a year.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we know now this is in fact an abandoned factory. A desolate, God forsaken alley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Imagination getting the better of you, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, course not. Just wish we had more to show for our efforts, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The thing that I don’t get is why would a currency trader like David Locke come down here? It just doesn’t make any sense.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He had a dark side we knew nothing about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All I know is that normal people don’t come to places like this at 2AM in the morning. In fact, I think I’ve seen enough, haven’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait. Do you hear that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not falling for that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. I’m serious. Listen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Footsteps.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lots of them.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: They’re after us! They’re after us!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: They’re coming! Don’t just stand there! Run!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What the hell’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s – that’s a – that’s a zombie horde.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no such thing as zombies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure I don’t have to tell you to aim for the head.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! Behind us. We’re surrounded. Oh jeez, oh jeez. You don’t have enough bullets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s ground zero for World War Z.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get behind me. We’ll have to fight our way out. Uh …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no way this is real. NYPD! Stop moving, now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And stop pretending to be zombies!

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Hey, hey, hey, hey. Take it easy. We’re just zombie walking here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re what?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Zombie walking. It’s like an amped up form of tag. We dress up like zombies and we chase the normal.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: That would be us.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, if we tag them we turn them and they become zombies, too. Look, if this is because we didn’t get a permit –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not. You’re all coming with me. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did I now know about this? This is outstanding. Did you do this yourself?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Being a fan of zombie lore, I get it. But what’s the appeal of being a zombie? Like look at this guy. Who would want to be alive in a decayed, mindless state? Being a vampire, that I understand. That’s the romantic route to immortality. The gentleman’s monster, as it were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of monsters, none of these zombies match the photo of our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s trying out a new look. How about you? If you could be any supernatural creature, what would it be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Van Helsing, no question.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Monster slayer. Befitting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And imagine, the monster that we are hunting might be in this very room.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, thanks ladies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know about those shoes with that top. Just sayin’. I would’ve went open toed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys having more luck than we are?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not at all. Oh, and guess what? None of these knuckleheads are real zombies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think what my colleague means to say is that no one recognizes our zombie from the video or our victim David Locke.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If David wasn’t part of the zombie crowd then what was he doing down there?

utterance.speaker: RHETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t part of our group, I can tell you that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about you? Do you recognize him?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul, are you high right now?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa. Hey now. Where’s that … coming from? No. No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Right. Um… Yeah, yeah. I don’t know this dude. He’s not a – a zombie or a normal.

utterance.speaker: RHETT
utterance.content: Listen, will this take much longer? I have class in the morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a student?

utterance.speaker: RHETT
utterance.content: Uh, teacher.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RHETT
utterance.content: Assistant professor of anthropology. I believe our fascination with zombies is a cultural phenomenon. A commentary on the inner numbness of modern life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. Do either of you recognize this … uh .. … zombie.

utterance.speaker: RHETT
utterance.content: That’s Kyle. Kyle Jennings.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! Kyle Jennings!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s him. Kyle!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So do we have cause of death?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I assume by ‘we’ you mean me. I’ll have answers after I cut him open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Charming.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: We’re all meat, Castle. Get over it. What I can tell you is his teeth match the bite marks and the blood on his clothes came from the victim. Kyle Jennings is your killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But the question is, who killed him?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Isn’t that always the question.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah…

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: What is it, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I was just … wondering. Before this man died, he was behaving exactly like a zombie. Is there any medical way to determine if he actually was … one?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Why – why is he in my morgue? There are no zombies, Castle. This is a man. He was a live man, now he’s a dead man. End of story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s undead!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, call for backup!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How – how do I -?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 9. Is there a police code for zombie on the loose?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So based on the latest report from the ER, Kyle Jennings was transferred up to ICU. He is stable but under sedation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m telling you, that guy was dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Remind me never to choke on a chicken bone in front of you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey! You checked that guy. So did the paramedics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa, you guys. I’m sure there is a medical explanation for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh… there’s an explanation, all right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Besides that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. You were there. You saw it. He rose from the dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He didn’t rise from the dead, Castle. He wasn’t dead in the first place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s not a zombie, Castle. He’s just a murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, what was his motive for murder, Detective Esposito?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kyle sold insurance. He had no criminal record, there’s no evidence that he even knew our victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a human killer, with a human motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or he’s a zombie killer. With a zombie motive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tasty brains.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, Castle, do you really believe in all this zombie stuff? Because I would swear on my Nana’s grave that Kyle Jennings was dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. You know what I do believe in? Driving Beckett crazy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I have to say. It’s good to see you guys hitting it off again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well Castle, it looks like we’ll get our motive straight from the source. Mr. Kyle Jennings is officially awake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Kyle, I’m Detective Beckett. This is Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: KYLE JENNINGS
utterance.content: What am I doing here? Why are there cops outside? No one’s telling me anything. What, was I mugged or something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to ask you a few questions about David Locke.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This man.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I don’t know him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two nights ago he went on a zombie walk. Did the two of you meet there?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I’ve never seen the guy before. What is this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was murdered. Beaten to death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened at that zombie walk?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I can’t remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what’s the last thing you do remember?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Uh … I got dressed to head over there. The next think I know I woke up in the morgue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you drink or do drugs that night?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: I don’t do that stuff. Look, I didn’t hurt anyone, okay. I would never do that. I just – I don’t remember anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the victim’s blood was found on your clothes, bite marks match your teeth, the cuff of your shirt was clutched in his hand, and a security camera caught our killer on tape. Is that you, Kyle?

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Yes. That’s me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you’re going to need a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Kyle killed someone he never met for no reason. Is that what we’re supposed to believe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well isn’t that what you said zombies do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is with a sad heart that I say that man is no zombie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, even though he rose from the dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s common knowledge that when you turn into a zombie you cannot turn back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you concede to the fact that there’s a medical explanation to all of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I concede to nothing, except that Kyle is not telling us the whole story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think he remembers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When a life altering moment occurs, people remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well maybe it’s too big to deal with. Maybe he … can’t face it just yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you think he ever will be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hopefully. If he feels safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Perlmutter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I came to tend to one of my patients. Kyle Jennings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … do you think that’s such a good idea?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I’ll have you know I’m perfectly capable of treating living patients. I simply prefer not to. I made an exception here because the results of his blood work were quite unusual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Kyle Jennings had scopolamine in his system, which in small doses is used to treat motion sickness. In larger doses it acts on the central nervous system to promote compliant and suggestible behavior.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly how suggestible?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: You’ll basically do whatever you’re told.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It’s like a date rape drug, except the victims remain conscious. And when the drug wears off, they’ll have no recollection of what happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it possible somebody slipped Kyle that drug?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I think it’s highly probable that they did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What time do you think he was given the scopolamine?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Between 2:45 and 3:45 the night of the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s when he was on that zombie walk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone on that zombie walk drugged Kyle and sent him after David. Kyle’s innocent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Far from an act of zombie mayhem, this murder was fiendishly deliberate. It was meticulously planned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By someone with a powerful motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With access to those drugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was also at our zombie walk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we interviewed those people. There’s no evidence that David knew any of them or had anything to do with the zombie scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well we know he was down there. He had to have gone there for a reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe our best bet is to work this through the drug angle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, I got started on that and I did some research on scopolamine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Quite the list of side effects, including drowsiness, confusion, slurred speech, death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it available on the street?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s uncommon, but it’s out there. And get this, users refer to it as the zombie drug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I know just the zombie to tell us all about it.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: What is this? I answered all your guys’ questions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When you were here last time, what were you on?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: On? What do – what do you mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were under the influence, Paul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Heavily … under the influence. Was it scopolamine?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Whoa, what now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you use the zombie drug?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I suppose that’s … possible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do any of the other zombies use it?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Some do. Some say is enhances the zombie experience.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you get it?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: A guy I know sells the stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? What’s his name?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I don’t know. I never ask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, describe him.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Dark hair, tall, over 6 feet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this him?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks for coming in again, Tom.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Sure. Though I’m not sure what I can do. I heard you caught the guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we just needed you to help us tie up a few loose ends. So, this is our suspect, Kyle Jennings.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Yeah, I remember from last time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, you said you’ve never seen him before.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: He’d be hard to miss, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s funny. Because Kyle said he saw you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he says you were at the zombie walk. You never told us you were part of the zombie subculture.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Detective, I’m pre-law. I have no time for regular culture, let alone subculture.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh Tom, you’re too modest. A number of zombies sang your praises.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Apparently you’re the real go to guy for the real zombie experience with the scopolamine.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a kid from Ridgewood, Tom. You don’t even have a job. And yet you manage to afford a really nice apartment and you’re able to pay your tuition.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I took out student loans. Look, I – I’m – I’m not a drug dealer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re trying to get ahead. You know, make a life with Greta. And then she steps out with some Wall Street douche, who would just not let her go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: David wanted to see Greta the night that he was killed. She said no. We canvassed the area. He was seen sitting in his car outside of your apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you left that night he followed you to the zombie walk. I’m betting he told you he was going to fight for Greta.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was handsome, he had money, the two of them had a history. I mean, you knew you couldn’t compete.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, especially when David told Greta you’re nothing but a lowlife drug dealer. You had to take matters into your own hands. Or more specifically, Kyle’s hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you had this brilliant plan. You dosed Kyle with scopolamine, told him to kill David thinking nobody would ever figure it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, that last part didn’t work out so well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: All you have is the word of a few whacked out zombies. That’s not even close to probable cause.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, that’s all I need to keep you here for 24 hours. And by then I will have my proof.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: No you won’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s right. We’ve got nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing is a strong word.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only person that can link Tom to the killing is Kyle and he doesn’t remember anything. And on top of all of that, the evidence shows that Kyle alone committed the murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, when you put it like that… yes, it sounds a little bleak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe this is it. What every homicide cop fears. The perfect murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. This is not the perfect murder. Can’t be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It happens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not to me. Not unless I’ve written it. No, we’re just missing something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like proof. Without it we did the only thing we could. We went at Tom head on. He didn’t blink. We’re out of moves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve got one move left. We went at Tom head on. Now we need to go at him sideways. And I know just what to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greta, I know how you feel. You’re in love with Tom and you want to see the best in him, but you have to look at the facts.

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: What you’re saying isn’t true. Okay. None of it is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then take the money. How is he able to pay for an apartment in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: Not by being a drug dealer, I’ll tell you that much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about that engagement ring? How can he afford that?

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: He said it was his grandmother’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greta, you are my last chance. If you don’t help me, an innocent man is going to go to prison. For life. For David’s murder.

utterance.speaker: GRETA
utterance.content: No. Tom’s the innocent one, okay? You got your killer and it’s not my fiancé.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Still waiting on that proof of yours. No? Nothing? Ah. Thanks for the hospitality. Is there a comment card I can fill out about the level of service I received?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re free to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take advantage while you can.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: You know, Greta told me about your little conversation. That was you big play? To use my own fiancée against me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s gonna figure out who you are sooner or later, so what are you gonna do about it then?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Kyle Jennings made bail. Got released a couple of hours ago.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Wait, Kyle is out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His bail was set at a million dollars. Where did he get the money?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out he’s got an uncle who’s got some serious dough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d steer clear of him if I were you.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: What kind of lies did you tell him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We didn’t tell him anything. But Kyle’s a smart guy. He’s gonna do the math.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I want police protection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you didn’t do anything wrong.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I didn’t. But thanks to you, Kyle thinks that I did and now he’s out there.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: You’re releasing me with knowledge and forethought that he could attack me. If he does, think about the lawsuit I’ll file against you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Esposito, please process Mr. Williams and then escort him to his apartment and make sure it’s clear. And after that, you are on your own.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I’ll be sure to check excellent service on that comment card.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I want a patrol car outside the building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, that’s not gonna happen. I’m gonna come in and let you –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get down and stay in the car!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! Drop the bat and show me your hands.

utterance.speaker: ZOMBIE
utterance.content: I know what you did to me.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I didn’t! I didn’t!

utterance.speaker: ZOMBIE
utterance.content: You made me kill a man and now I’m going to do the same to you.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Oh, no! Please! I … I’m very sorry.

utterance.speaker: ZOMBIE
utterance.content: You’re lying!

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: No! I swear! He was going to take Greta away from me! I had to do something!

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I’m sorry I used you. Just – please. Please. Please don’t hurt me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Enough.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Huh? Good actor, huh? I had you going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tom Williams, you are under arrest for the murder of David Locke.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Wait, hang on a second. Just – Kyle?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Kyle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry. Kyle couldn’t make it. But he, uh … sends his regards.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turn around. Turn around.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gotta tell you, bro. Coming at me like that? You almost make me a believer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop it. Don’t do that. You’re creeping me out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really nailed it, Kyle. Your costume is what sold that bit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and by helping us you actually helped yourself. The DA is looking in to dismissing the charges against you now that he has Tom’s confession.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: Detective, Mr. Castle. I – I don’t know how to thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh. Let me borrow the zombie outfit for another day, we’ll call it even.

utterance.speaker: KYLE
utterance.content: You know what? Keep it. My zombie walking days are over. I just want to put all this behind me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does somebody put something like that behind them? He’s going to need therapy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It helps. First he won’t even be able to deal with it. It’s going to take everything he’s got to just put one foot in front of the other and get through the day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t know you were seeing a therapist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I didn’t want to make any excuses. I just wanted to put in the time and do the work. But I think I’m almost where I want to be now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And where is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In a place where I can finally accept everything that happened that day. Everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think … I understand…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And um… that wall I was telling you about? I think it’s coming down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’d like to be there when it does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’d like you to be there, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only without the zombie makeup.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. I kinda think that the zombie makeup suits you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I make it work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Victory is mine. One… thousand… points. And that is the icing on the cake that has been my day.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s it? It’s over?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? C’mon, Alexis. It’s just a game.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A game we started when I was 5. And it’s over. And I’m going to graduate, leave for college and I’ll be there and you’ll be here and we can play at Christmas and during the summer, but it won’t be the same, will it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But you know what? Things change. And change is good.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Go that far away. I want to go away, but not that far. And I hate myself for it, because my personal motto is do the thing that you fear the most, but every time I get ready to hit the accept button on my acceptance to Oxford or Stanford I – I get all sick inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well you … follow your heart. Follow your heart and you can’t go wrong.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And my heart is telling me … go to Columbia.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But here’s the other thing. If I do this you have to promise not to drop in on me. If I do this, you have to give me my space. Do you think you can do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I can give a sincere and solemn oath … to … try.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then … Best two out of three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t over! This isn’t over.
